bibl.title: Late Roman Cushions and the Principles of their Decoration.
bibl.note: 1. Comforting the living and the dead. - 2. Written sources. - 3. Archaeological evidence. - 4. Filling materials. - 5. Shapes and designs. - 6. Loop piles. - 7. Banded design in tabby weave. - 8. Two-face designs in tapestry weave. - 9. Conclusions. - 10. Perspectives.

bibl.title: assisted by Susanne Martinssen-von Falck, Clothing the House. Furnishing Textiles of the 1st Millennium AD from Egypt and Neighbouring Countries. Proceedings of the 5th Conference of the Research Group 'Textiles from the Nile Valley', Antwerp, 6-7 October 2007.

bibl.seg: Paetz gen. Schieck Annette, Late Roman Cushions and the Principles of their Decoration.
